website_summaries.verdict: The Amazfit Bip is affordable, has fantastic battery life, and is the best low-key casual smartwatch around. It's a fine replacement for your old-school Pebble, minus the apps.
pros: The Amazfit Bip is a complete fitness smartwatch that's a remarkable bargain
It has an always-on display, weeks-long battery life, plus extras like heart rate, GPS and water resistance
cons: Plastic design and limited watch faces aren't as flashy as premium smartwatches
Mi Fit app isn't as refined as Fitbit for fitness or health tracking
Onboard features like stopwatch/timer can't run in background

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth is horrible.  I hope the hardware is defective and isolated.
customer_reviews.text: Got the watch and was able to configure and sync very easily. Within a couple of days the bluetooth began to flake out, dropping the connection. I followed the troubleshooting directions on the website and did a factory reset. Now the watch is bricked. Tried multiple phones with no success. Nothing I have will connect at all. I tried in all environments without any other bluetooth active. Not happy about this watch at all except that when it worked it was brilliant then it died. Returning this immediately. Thank goodness for Amazon's return process.
customer_reviews.author: B K

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love this Amazfit BIP just what i wanted from a smartwatch. I wear it all day to check my BPM and steps and for my sleep patterns i can't even tell i'm wearing it because it is so light and comfortable! Gives me push notifications as well which is great. All sorts of watch faces that can be downloaded from google play as well. I fully charged it 7 days ago and the battery is still at 72% with everything on so great battery life. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Watch is even not detected by IPhone
customer_reviews.text: Watch is even not detected by IPhone although Bluetooth enabled. Android phone is able to detect watch but pairing option not seen in the watch. I charged the watch but watch is stuck in the same mode since 4 days. I can see " Phone and Watch symbols with a Bidirectional arrow pointing to both sides " on the watch display. I tried to power recycle the watch but see the same status. Did I lost my $ .....
customer_reviews.author: ciscoprize

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Heart rate was off unless you are in activity— it shows me at 125 when i was biking on flat ground. It also having a lot of issue syncing with my iPhone.overall, not worth it
customer_reviews.author: Veteran Ng

customer_reviews.title: Sleep monitor stopped working after 2.5 months
customer_reviews.text: Functions fine as a watch, but the sleep monitor feature stopped working after 2.5 months. That was the feature I liked the best. PROS: the battery life is as advertised screen is easy to read usually alerts me when my phone gets a text or call CONS: sleep monitor doesn't work anymore heart monitor is spotty (if I make the watch any tighter it will cut off circulation to my hand) sometimes doesn't alert me to texts or calls takes a long time to sync with my phone hard to get the watch on the charger properly Overall - I'd return the watch if it was still within the return window. Since it isn't, I'll grudgingly keep using it.
customer_reviews.author: abezon

customer_reviews.title: Low Price, Long Battery Life, Phone alerts
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product for my wife she loves it. Her son paid six times more for one that you can talk on. This is a watch that alerts calls, messages, and monitors a variety of functions, at a very, very, reasonable price. The best features are the heart, pulse, and sleep monitoring, according to her. I must mention the awesome battery life. It is the longest on an device I have ever seen. Her girlfriends can not believe how reasonable the price was for this Amazfit Bit. I Highly Recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: joseph m.

customer_reviews.title: Screen suddenly popped off
customer_reviews.text: It has been a great product, great battery life. But yesterday, after around 10 months of use, the screen suddenly popped off. I've seen this problem posted many times on related forums, even jerryrigeverything made a video about it, and was hoping that this wouldn't be my case, but it was. The adhesive shown on his video is not on my watch, and the screen just came out. Will be contacting Amazfit and update later
customer_reviews.author: Jay En Kay

customer_reviews.title: Six months out. Major fail!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch in February. Overall I was satisfied with it. I had to replace the band because I didn’t like the material it was made of but that’s a minor thing. The watch is light and works as advertised. Last night I put it on the charger to charge in this morning all I get is some Chinese characters on the screen. Damn thing stopped working. Try to Contact Amazon and lo and behold the warranty expired on the 15th. Just my luck. So I would not recommend this product to friends.
customer_reviews.author: UncleSnake

customer_reviews.title: Best bargain smart watch
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Who would have thought a smart watch could only have to be charged every 6+ weeks?! Texts and calls show up on my wrist, letting me decide whether to dig out my iPhone each time. GPS and heart rate monitor deplete the battery much faster, but I don't use those features. Watch is readable in all but the dimmest light (without the backlight!). The wife says the reddish-orange case is stylish (I wouldn't know). OK, it's not as fancy as the Apple and Samsung watches, but it's a fifth the price and doesn't need charging all the time. It's a winner IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Amazing watch for the price! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing device. 3 weeks in still left with 56% battery for my use. I am loving it. I recommended this device to 6 of my friends and 3 of them bought it and they love it. Don't expect an Apple watch / Samsung gear features for the price you paid for this device and I am sure you will love it. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a fitness tracker with heart rate monitor that also was a watch and had decent battery life. I had a smart watch that had to be charged at least every other day. The Amazfit does everything I need at a good price. Plus it keeps my phone unlocked when I have it on me. It's so comfortable that I wear it at night and track my sleep. The program isn't very difficult to download and use. I'm not an athlete so I can't speak to how it would do for serious runners. But I am impressed for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS THE ONE
customer_reviews.text: I must have sent back a half of dozen smart watches back to Amazon. I had the Samsung gear 1, 2, and 3. The battery life was not good and must be charged daily. Not this watch. I went on vacation for over three weeks and came home with 50 percent charge left. It does everything you want and only has to be charged once a month or less. You can always see the time on the face but if you twist your wrist, it lights up. I"m a senior so I chose a large numeral screen. This is by far the best watch I have as a daily user. THIS IS THE ONE
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Real Pros/Cons
customer_reviews.text: Amazfit Bip -First off their should be a warning telling you that 90% of all the clock faces you’ll find for this watch are not 12 hour but 24 hour. That’s the big con for this watch, along with occasional disconnect for weather or notifications. Oh and no bitmoji only boxes with ??? . The pros are: it’s light and comfy, the battery last longer than any other watch and It gets the job done cheap and easy . This is more of a fitness tracker that can also tell time and weather not so much a smart watch with very few nice clock faces.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: This thing has no audio. So...
customer_reviews.text: It does what I need it to do. Here's what it can: track number of steps heart rate alarm phone app notifications calender activity workout tracking It CAN'T: play music make/pick up phone calls google assistant map AUDIO! So this thing is incapable of audio. And it has a LCD screen instead of LED. But it has huuuuuge battery life. No need to charge in a month as I'm using it.
customer_reviews.author: Li Tian

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay middle of the road
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting more from the watch. Far from a 30 day battery life. I have nothing on but steps and sleep tracker and it’s at 50% in 5 days. I could have gotten that from any of the health watch’s. Selling point for me was put it on and forget about it for few weeks. Build quality is not great but not as bad as other trackers. Would be nice if it was waterproof and if the glass screen was made out of something stronger and more scratch resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: This watch has an amazing battery life. I charged it once it was delivered and my next charge was 34 days later.. that's just nutts.. it doesn't have all the high tech bells and whistles that the iwatch has but for this price it has ALOT. I ordered the orange and get so many compliments. Everyone always ask me which iwatch do I have. Dont even think about it.. just buy it
customer_reviews.author: Julio Padilla

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch but seems like software needs optimization
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice entry level fitness watch. I bought this since it had GPS to track my workouts. Battery life is good but not as much as advertised. It have me about 15 days on first charge. Probably depends on use of GPS on daily. The problem I face is it does not automatically detect your workout. So you need to start tracking manually before starting workouts. It gives a vibrating alert on completion of every mile, which is nice. Yesterday, I faced a issue though with it suggesting to close tracking & suddenly stopped tracking my run.
customer_reviews.author: Amit

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely impressed and satisfied! This was just the type of watch I wanted, and the user friendliness and ease of us and functionality was spot on perfect. I use it mainly to track my running distance. And for the sleep tracking. Its so easy to use, has a no-clutter functionality feel to it that is quick and easy, and just an overall fantastic product. Price is unbelieable in my opinion for such a quality product. Totally loving my new watch and would highly recommend it to others looking for a great fitness watch.
customer_reviews.author: Mo Mammad

customer_reviews.title: Just spend the money for a FitBit
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a replacement for another brand tracker that didn't charge. This one was better, it came with an actual charging port/stand. But the sleep tracker is way off. And the steps didnt track very well either. Finally got frustrated and broke down and spent the money on a FitBit since I had already spent that much on the two cheaper options. Must have a smart phone to use, so cant give it my kid either.
customer_reviews.author: detentionplz

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't always work
customer_reviews.text: I love the battery life and the color. But many times I would go to touch the screen to see texts or something along those lines and it wouldn't work. If you didn't select to always have the heart rate running you couldn't select when to check it. There was no option to get rid of all notifications at one time had to go through individually and nothing that told you you had a notification unless you pressed the screen and swiped to look at them. Which isn't that big of a deal but would be nice. I was most frustrated that I couldn't get it to work consistently.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: Love the battery life, but that's about it
customer_reviews.text: I'm comparing this mostly to the Pebble Time smartwatch which I'm a huge fan of. RIP. I absolutely love the 30 day battery life, it's amazing! The problems are that it just feels a little cheap, it's not very substantial and the software isn't all that great. For instance, there are only a few watch faces that even have non-military time. Most of them are military time and even the one that I found that isn't military time uses 0:01 for midnight instead of 12. It's odd. All and all, it's not awesome. But it's okay. I hope they improve the software. This could easily be a great watch.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: New User So Far
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Price, design, features. CONS: GPS degrades battery life ( I was aware of that). Read about a 45-day battery life but with GPS enabled ( I'm a runner and also walk a lot), I get about a week before having to recharge. I can live with that. If you don't suspend GPS and you get into a car, it will continue to track your mileage. I keep forgetting to suspend and enable. Vibration is a bit week in the stopwatch mode. Again, no biggy. Colors on the watch face are pale Had the 1st generation Fitbit before, but much happier with this watch. MI Fit app provides a lot of statistics and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. It's extremely comfortable and lives up to its word. The sleep/steps/weather/etc all seem to be pretty much on target. I LOVE the battery life. I really thought I'd be charging this at least once a week. I bought it before Christmas and have only charged it once!! Next problem is remembering where I put the charger since I use it so infrequently. LOL. Can't beat this for the price.
customer_reviews.author: joycefl6

customer_reviews.title: Garbage with great battery life. Heart rate monitor wildly inaccurate, notifications buzzing.
customer_reviews.text: The heart rate monitor says I'm at 60 when I'm exercising and my heart's going like crazy. The Google Hangouts notifications arrive but the Bip notifies me of Previous messages, resulting in sometimes one dozen vibrations. Totally annoying, and I can stop to read one, like it's a buzz machine...ugh. Undesirably performs Updates to the watch when I use their Android App, freezing the watch for 1 minute, with GPS data...I can't stop it, I just wanted to change my heart rate tracking and it freezes my work out. Total fail for gym workouts, fails to track the session because GPS is not going anywhere. Why do they do this? Garbage with great battery life.
customer_reviews.author: N. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Good move from Pebble Time
customer_reviews.text: I am getting almost the same functionality out of this watch as I did from my Pebble Time. I charged it after 30 days, and it still had 25% remaining on the battery. From that I would guess the 45 day claim is not far off. I have found apps that: *provide turn by turn navigation with google maps *metronome using the vibrate function *control music on my phone So, far there isn't much I'm missing from my Pebble.
customer_reviews.author: teamjt

customer_reviews.title: Better by the day!
customer_reviews.text: A watch that I initially liked I now love. The battery life is insane compared to all other trackers. It lasts Weekes at a time and this isnusign the goana few times a week and havng the continuous heart rate on. Come in great colors and gets compliments all the time. I will certainly be referring to friends and getting as gifts for family. Best on market for price and even higher price brackets
customer_reviews.author: americannomad

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the features
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for about a week and it does everything they claim. Some of the complaints in the poor reviews are things I was able to figure out. There's very little in the way of instructions so I just winged it. I am happy with it. The battery life is incredible. I only charged it up to about 1/3 initially and it still has 1 bar. I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: I have had this smartwatch for 15 months and it had been good, I can't say great because the app doesn't always want work or connect. But today the face popped off. Sitting at my desk and I hear a pop and look down to find the face hanging of my a connection.
customer_reviews.author: dgmeade

customer_reviews.title: Holy Cow!
customer_reviews.text: What a battery life! Watch was delivered July 13th, fully charged it on July 14th when I finally unboxed it. Today is August 29th and I am having to recharge it for the first time! Pretty impressed with this watch and I haven't even tried all of the features yet. I wanted something cheap was even just looking at solar digital watches, but went with this and do not regret it at all!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua S Brown

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced watch that's kinda works as a fitness watch
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Smaller watch with a decent screen. I was happy with the look. Easy to tell time. Notification from phone worked nicely Cons: Really difficult to read the screen other than the time. Heart Rate sensor was not reliable. Way off when exercising. Compared against equipment sensor and taking my pulse. Submitted feedback and only received a thank from an odd email. App is also very basic I bought a different brand used fitness watch within 2 months of purchase for the same price. Slightly bulky but the watch function is leaps and bounds better.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Best battery life
customer_reviews.text: It lasts forever before I have to recharge. It is also pretty sturdy. I wear it all the time and have never had any problems with it. The sleep tracking works pretty well most of the time although sometimes it isn't quite right. If I get up in the middle of the night and read for a while before going back to sleep, it doesn't always detect that. Overall I am very happy with this activity tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Banny

customer_reviews.title: Check Out THIS Smart Watch!
customer_reviews.text: OMG - a friend told me about this when I was considering a much more expensive smart watch. It does everything except answer your phone - as in you cannot talk into the watch- but I don’t want to. Calls show, text messages show, timer, weather, activity and more - amazing. AND, the battery lasts over A WEEK! More amazing. I love it. My Fitbit band and casing actually fell apart. This one is all replaceable. BEST price EVER.
customer_reviews.author: Bonny E.

customer_reviews.title: Battery life and durability yes! Alerts needs improving
customer_reviews.text: Great battery life. I spend about a week with out charging it. I shower without any damages. Some of annoying things are the lights dim quickly and if your 15+ steps away from your phone or if your phone phone is buried in your pocket the bluetooth is disconnected. Also, if you are getting a lot of text messages from one person, the watch will count all the messages and alert you of "x number" of messages instead of all the individual messages. Some of the messages appear twice. Finally the watch can only hold maybe 15 alerts at a time. BUT when it comes to durability it's really good. Sleeping log activity is pretty accurate. And its super lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great watch at a great price. Love it! Keep an eye on the band.
customer_reviews.text: **** UPDATE! Still a great watch, but oddly after months of wearing it 24/7, I developed a nasty rash from the band. Easily fixed I ordered a nylon band. The Battery Life alone, makes this a worthwhile purchase. I have had a few $$$$ smart watches that have died over the years. At this price I won't shed a tear. The screen isn't much to talk about, but the sleep and GPS function are damn good.
customer_reviews.author: Tsikusr

customer_reviews.title: Returned after three weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I read so many positive reviews online about how great it was especially for about seventy dollars. However I returned mine after three weeks. My review is based on using it with an Android phone running pie. What's good. Battery life and heart rate monitor. What's bad. Very small font size. Can't respond to texts. Dismissed notifications don't dismiss on the phone. Poor selection of watch faces. Inaccurate step counter.
customer_reviews.author: madronemedia

customer_reviews.title: Good Fitness tracker... Okay smart watch
customer_reviews.text: If you need something that mostly does fitness tracking, this is the device for you. Its a good price, seems very durable, has great battery life. In terms of being a smart watch, its very basic.. Notifications are simple lines of text, which for some is perfect, but I like notifications looking a little more rich in content. Summing it up, for the money its a great fitness tracker with some basic smart watch capabilities that I can recommend as a first smart watch.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Budd

customer_reviews.title: Great product but buggy GPS tracker
customer_reviews.text: I really liked all this watch had to offer: long battery life, phone and text monitoring, sleep tracking, and also GPS-enabled fitness tracking that doesn't continuously pulse EM into your body. Unfortunately after 6 months the GPS elevation tracking went loopy. A ride around my neighborhood showed an astonishing (and false) 2,000 foot elevation gain. Two months later, all fitness functions failed if GPS was turned on. Performing a full reset resolved the crashing issue but did not fix the buggy elevation readings. Great product, but ultimately disappointing. I still wear it (hence generous 3 stars) but looking for better.
customer_reviews.author: Noel

customer_reviews.title: Highly functioning smart watch for a great price
customer_reviews.text: If you have issues with technology I would not purchase this watch. Otherwise if you can figure things out with ease this is a great purchase. I was able to sync to Strava after d/l some apps and the HR is semi accurate (compared to Garmin HR strap). The battery life is incredible lasting easily 2 weeks while running 2-3 times per week (~hr per run). The gps is spot on. If you want to use for indoor activities the watch is good, but for some reason these activities do not sync to Strava.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: What a bargain!
customer_reviews.text: This is obviously no Apple Watch so the display won't look as crisp and there is no app support whatsoever. The watch has tons of customizable watchfaces and the battery life is unreal. I've used it for over a week so far and I've only lost 27% battery. I haven't had to charge the device since buying it and that's with GPS, all day heart rate monitoring and sleep tracking turned on. This is how a watch should be.
customer_reviews.author: Alex P.

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for a small price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: price, battery life is amazing, multiple faces, heart rate and steps are fairly accurate, and mates with Google Fit Cons: the charger is a little hard to seed in correctly. The sleep monitor is accurate on deep sleep and lite sleep but not accurate on awake times. Overall I think this is a good watch for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kandieman

customer_reviews.title: Poor product from company that does not place effort to correct product
customer_reviews.text: Was good at first. But after a year the battery life does not last more than 20mins after full charge. I have contacted Huami and they have not gotten back in touch with me. Seems like Huami produces product that has a short life span. I would suggest getting a different fitness tracker from a company that backs their products like Fitbit if you don't want to go with apple products
customer_reviews.author: Bartleby

customer_reviews.title: Terrible GPS, Broken touchscreen
customer_reviews.text: Do not use for running! I used the Amazfit bip for a marathon, and the watch had numerous GPS problems during the race. It overshot the couse by 3 miles. I have never had this problem with any other gps watch. The current pace calculations are very inaccurate. They fluctuate wildly. The watch touchscreen also died in the middle of the race.
customer_reviews.author: J Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Qestioning the Quality!!!!  PLEASE REVIEW THE BELOW PRIOR TO YOUR PURCHASING THIS WATCH
customer_reviews.text: This watch is malfunctioning as of 4 February, 4 days after my return option has closed. It will not stop the workout mode when pushing on the watch as instructed and as a result, it runs until it has drained the battery. It appears to be unreliable not as advertised and I am very upset with its quality. BE VERY CAREFUL WHEN GIVING THOUGHT TO PURCHASING THIS WATCH!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas C.

customer_reviews.title: watch was unable to connect to mi fit app
customer_reviews.text: after nor being able to connect to my phone app because the continuously was searching for e-gps on my watch. It ran for 7 days before the battery went dead. I recharged the watch and the same searching for gps continued. I went online to find a solution and after 5 days dealing with there online and email communications the problem is still not resolved. I would not purchase this product again!!!
customer_reviews.author: rxman

customer_reviews.title: Holy long lasting battery life Batman!
customer_reviews.text: The battery truly lasts a week, even with constant use. This watch suits my needs and I love that we can change the watch face design with a free app. The only minor complaints I have are that the touchscreen for turning off the alarm isn't as sensitive as I would like it to be but it does the job and wakes me up! I also don't like the rubbery feeling watch band. It tends to catch of my sleeves. I'd like to be able to switch the bands out. That being said, you cannot beat the quality of this watch for the price you pay!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer J

customer_reviews.title: Great Smartwatch for a Fair Price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great smartwatch for a fair price. The battery life is phenomenal, I like the way it looks, and there are cases and replacement bands available to change the color and look of the watch. It is easy to use and has all the features I was looking for (for example, heart rate monitor, text and call notifications, sleep tracker). I previously had a different smartwatch that was more expensive, but it ended up breaking very quickly. I am very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Clint Gilman

customer_reviews.title: Great smart watch!
customer_reviews.text: I have my watch on all the time and love the accurate tracking of my steps and sleep patterns. Just the other day though the screen completely came unglued. I have not banged it on anything or did anything for this to happen. I’m having a hard time trying to get ahold of customer service to see what they can do regarding this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Simona

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I noticed after an hour of working out that this product was telling me I had burned a total of 30 calories while my fitbit Alta I was wearing on the same wrist was reading 639. Will give another chance wearing both of them on the same wrist for the same work out and update if I need to.
customer_reviews.author: User739156420

customer_reviews.title: Lots to know
customer_reviews.text: I love it the best for my sleep tracking. It's fun to see and make sure I am getting enough deep sleep and not just light sleep. The step tracker isn't very accurate or I would give it 5 stars. You can't answer the phone or send text but u can read the text and see who is calling. I think it's pretty fun to have anyways. Not many choices for screen image but that's ok I am happy with the two I rotate with.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Some useful features but not exactly accurate
customer_reviews.text: The step tracker is really useful. I wish I could choose a 12 hr clock instead of the mandatory 24 hr military clock. Sleep tracking was pretty inaccurate, as it does a poor job of detecting when I get out of bed and start moving around. The heart rate monitor can be wildly inaccurate. The fit and design is great. Overall I'm still happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Choo

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this watch thinking it was the Fitbit brand but found out I could not sync it with my healthcare program. However I loved this watch so much that I refused to send it back even after I had purchased a Fitbit watch. I bought the black with the orange around it and it is very pretty. I get plenty of compliments when I wear it. It is lightweight and the screen is a nice size even for senior citizens like me. This watch has the usual tracker features and I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: MSB

customer_reviews.title: Runner friendly
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality for low pricing. I'm a D1 distance runner and this watch works perfect for long runs. The battery life is amazing, no need to charge every 3-5 days like the $300 garmin watches. Only downside in my opinion is its not really 100% waterproof, the straps are pretty sensitive to heat, so if you shower with it daily be ready to buy new straps every 3 to 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Konrad Trevino

customer_reviews.title: Decent for tracking long runs
customer_reviews.text: I already have a Fitbit Versa, but it’s connected GPS so I was looking for something cheap that has GPS for my long runs so I don’t use up data. This watch has GPS which is great and it seems pretty accurate. The app isn’t as well developed - you have to kind of dig for info on your exercises. The touchscreen is a little frustrating - you have to tap it multiple times to get it to work. It works for what I wanted it for, but I wouldn’t make this a full time fitness tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Great smart watch
customer_reviews.text: This watch is great. Smart features are good. You wont be installing new apps, but what it does is great. My wife uses it for daily wear and run tracking. Run tracking isn't viewable on the watch, but otherwise it is a GREAT device. The price point is awesome. If my fitbit versa conks out... i'm buying an amazfit bip
customer_reviews.author: Frank Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Not in it for the long haul
customer_reviews.text: I used this watch to track my daily steps, my distance running, heart rate, and notifications for texts and calls. The watch worked great for the first year, but after a year, the heart rate monitor was no longer accurate, and this week, the side button stopped working, so it is pretty much useless for tracking my workouts. The watch is only a year and a half old. I was initially so excited about the features available for the price, but now I have to buy another watch. I’ll probably do what I should have done first and buy an Apple or Garmin watch instead.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Bluemel

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life and great for most everything.
customer_reviews.text: Great watch overall. Excellent battery life. Great for tracking steps and workouts like running,biking, or walking. No, you can't answer calls or use it as a phone like the $400 ones. It does tell you when someone is calling and show you notifications including texts. The screen is great even in the sun. Honestly it's a great fitness tracker and watch. If you think you need all the bells and whistles then go drop $400 but this does everything I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Jens Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome watch for the price. Great tracker.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product... I compared the data against runkeeper and strava working in parallel there is not much difference in the data. Maybe 2 seconds off pace or about 0.05 miles difference in the total distance. HR it is what it is. At least I can track it down, pretty sure is not accurate enough, but I don't have any other device available to compare it. For the price... Awesome. Things I would love to have. The app should have a way to send the gpx to strava.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Perez

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Did not stand up to my FitBit. Did not track sleep properly. Not suitable for night shifters. FitBit tracked sleep regardless of the time.
customer_reviews.author: clutch_the_pearls

customer_reviews.title: Great Smart Watch, Great deal...
customer_reviews.text: Great little smart watch Does much of what Apple Watch does, at a fraction of the price! Tons of cool watchfaces and INSANE battery life (about 6 days on a single charge). Useful companion app. Very good deal overall. Only possible downside is that the case and screen are made of plastic, so probably not the most durable watch in the world (A screen protector might be a good idea). But at that price you can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Max Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch! Battery life is excellent. Have to charge it up 2 hours about once a month. Texts show clearly up on the screen and love where I can hang up calls I receive without digging out my phone. Has different apps for watch faces but like the one I have currently. Definitely would recommend this watch. Is waterproof which is a plus in my life. GPS function works great on my walks so I van track how far my walk was. Overall great smart watch
customer_reviews.author: Janina Murray

customer_reviews.title: APPS hard to use
customer_reviews.text: Watch works fine. Very hard to get any apps to work. You need to download MI FIT app to your cell phone. Then you have to pair watch to MI FIT app.This took forever to do. I would not recommend this watch.
customer_reviews.author: PAC716

customer_reviews.title: Piece of trash
customer_reviews.text: Simply the worst watch I have ever purchased and I can't seem to get the manufacturer or Amazon to care. I used to purchase from Amazon several times a week but now they are lucky if it's once a month because of this product. It won't read sleep data, you can't update the firmware on the watch amount other things but the most frustrating part is I can't get support on the thing! To summarize, buy one of the cheap exercise bands, you get 4 for the price of this and ur almost guaranteed one will work!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Long battery life but not very reliable or accurate
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is crazy it last at least a month between charges. Does not keep track of actual time well it is about 4 to 8 minutes off daily. Unreliable as far as steps my husband went to sleep one night and woke up it told him he had 600 steps taken while he slept it has a mind of its own
customer_reviews.author: Denice K Gudah

customer_reviews.title: Needs a lot of improving
customer_reviews.text: Besides the long battery life and nice color, over time I must say I’ve been unimpressed for the following reasons: 1) I usually go to bed with it on my wrist and woke up one morning to find the face had come off. Poor fabrication and sealing! 2) Have to manually set my location to read the weather from my watch. With GPS it shouldn’t be difficult to detect weather and locations dynamically. 3) The sync with my iPhone frequently breaks. Won’t be buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: NONSO

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little watch. Very durable and stylish. Works perfectly. Works with IPhone and Android both. Waterproof. Has health trackers. Has call and text message notifications. Has accurate weather. 12 and 24 hour time displays. Hundreds of cool watch faces. Charging dock that it sits on while charging. Heart rate monitor. Sleep monitor. GPS. Complete touch screen. Always on display. Weeks and weeks of battery life. Light weight. It uses the app MiFit. Like I said before it works on both iPhones and androids. And to get hundreds of different watch faces download the app AmazTools.
customer_reviews.author: NeonChef

customer_reviews.title: Great watch with amazing battery life
customer_reviews.text: This watch amazed me when it arrived. I thought it was just going to be a really crappy smartwatch but it was everything but that. The battery life is amazing I've gone 9 days without charging and it's still at 58%. The heart rate monitor is very good and accurate. The sleep tracking is pretty much on point and it hasn't given me an issue yet. One thing I don't really like is that my screen scratched like the day after I got it and there are some strange kind of splotches on the screen. Other than that the watch has been amazing so far and I do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: Worth to buy
customer_reviews.text: Good battery life 30-45days per spec. Cheap and reliable. Can get notification from apps, email, txt, and can check sleep, heartbeat, activities, etc ... worth and good deal compared to other smartwatch with higher price but probably similar function or less maybe.
customer_reviews.author: D. Liu

customer_reviews.title: I returned it
customer_reviews.text: I cant point to any one thing I didnt like, but I returned it. It wasn't very user friendly in my opinion. While only $80, I wanted a little more.
customer_reviews.author: Tshizzy

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is great !
customer_reviews.text: I really like this fitness watch. Its flat and comfortable to wear. I don't use all the features right now, but it seems very accurate and the battery life is unbelievable ! My one small complaint is that the time was in 24 hr, but I just downloaded a new watch face from an app and its fixed. Maybe they will offer more 12 hr watch faces soon.
customer_reviews.author: Brook Adams

customer_reviews.title: Battery is good but won't last 45 days as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The only good thing is the battery, which lasts a week or so but since this smart watch is a serious stripped down of all the smart functions, I expect the battery to last longer than other watches. On a full charge with a minimal configuration, it lasts for a week and a half. The weakness is the screen is very often non-responsive. When it is, you can't turn off the alarm or stop an activity that you had started.
customer_reviews.author: Chung Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Good watch!
customer_reviews.text: Great watch! I don't use it much, just for checking the weather forecast occasionally and time. I don't use Mi Fit, just Notify and Fitness for Amazfit as a standalone app, and it works well!
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: Will Not Sync
customer_reviews.text: Every time that I try to reset the alarms, I have to remove the watch from my iPhone, reset my iPhone and hope that it'll let me change the alarm times. If not, I have to do it again. Sometimes it'll up to an hour just to reset my alarms. I rely on my watch to get me up in the mornings and this proves that I need to go back to FitBit.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan DeLoach

customer_reviews.title: Color is misleading/wrong
customer_reviews.text: Don't advertise your color as cinnabar red when the watch is actually orange. Just say it's orange. Had to return it because of this. Even though it says elsewhere "orange" why even cause this unneeded confusion? I didn't even get the use the watch as the color was a deal breaker so I gave it 3/5 just cause.
customer_reviews.author: T. Goben

customer_reviews.title: Good, very good.
customer_reviews.text: Durable and well made for the price. Battery lasts forever. The interface is a little laggy on the face. It seems to freeze just when I need it, but all in all works well. I bought because it was cheaper than the competition, but a very reliable and sturdy price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great scree visibility even in direct sun.
customer_reviews.text: I have had my BIP for 2 weeks and love it. The battery life is amazing, still 35%, after this amount of time. Viewing the screen in very bright sunlight is awesome. The different watch faces that are available in the App store are great. Tracks my steps, heart beat, and steps nicely. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Coccia

customer_reviews.title: NOT a smartwatch, but a FitWatch
customer_reviews.text: I loved that this device was so long lasting! As someone who forgets to charge their devices often I was very impressed! The functionality seems too simple for me, only fit options, when I miss having music control and messaging access. My favorite part was the sleep tracker, though wearing this watch at night caused me to wake up to readjust it. Small screen, lightweight, nice design
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price and quality
customer_reviews.text: Great smart watch at a good price. Tracks steps, sleep, running, heart rate and much more! I purchased this for my husband 7 months ago and he wears it everyday, he runs a lot and he loves it!! It connects to his phone and reports a lot of data that he can keep track of. It also alerts him if his heart rate it too high and also when he gets phone calls and texts. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok for fitness, pretty terrible watch
customer_reviews.text: It is my fault for not looking closer at the features of this device but I am super disappointed. I was hoping it would have basic watch functionality such as a timer and alarm that could be controlled from the watch, rather than my phone. But no luck. So, this thing is useless to me and I'll go back to my Timex.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Bought this july 21st 2018, for the year and a smidge it did work as a watch, displayed notifications, but it was never "great". Screen simply popped off, probably just gonna glue it back on and go about my day. My pebble was still better.
customer_reviews.author: Sabine

customer_reviews.title: Heart rate monitor wouldn't read
customer_reviews.text: Really nice inexpensive smart watch. Watch was lightweight and comfortable but after one day the heart rate monitor wasn't reading. It could have been a defect. I returned the watch.
customer_reviews.author: joseph t. grappone jr.

customer_reviews.title: Not a very smart watch
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Amazfit Bip as a watch that had a vibrating alarm and not for smart features. It’s smart features are inconsistent as I frequently wake in the morning with the watch reading as many as 141 steps while I slept, During a long drive while I hadn’t been out of the car I suddenly achieved 6,000 steps and the watch can vary considerably from what it’s own phone app records when going for a run. If your looking for a smart watch look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Bought on basis of reviews and the watch bore no resemblance to them. Basic watch is in 24 hour format only. Battery life was 3 days. Would not sync with iPhone and their solution was to reinstall software repeatedly. Sleep function works great but it could not keep the data in order when the system was rebooted. This should be a minus 5 star rating. Notifications never worked. Still waiting on response from their customer service. Watch was returned without question and problems to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch
customer_reviews.text: I am giving the Bio three stars based on what I saw when opening the box. Upon first view I think it looks a little cheap. I would charge a higher price and get rid of the plastic trim. The watch functions very well probably even better than expected. The only downside is the appearance.
customer_reviews.author: KWB

customer_reviews.title: Fixed this problem by dropping and re-adding the device to the phone.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is an excellent idea. I had problems with the watch, published a critique and was subsequently contacted by their support people, (yes they exist). I followed their instructions and my watch came back to life. Thanks to them, I am now using the device once again. The Sleep App is excellent and a big help.
customer_reviews.author: William S. Holderby

customer_reviews.title: Beware of small face size
customer_reviews.text: The size of the watch face is very deceiving. Would not have purchased had I know how small the watch face was. Makes it hard to read any data. The clock styles are poorly designed and need updating. Step count is good. Heart monitor is slow and marginally accurate. Battery is good. This could be a great watch if all the data received was better designed to easily read. Just coping Fitbit would be a good start.
customer_reviews.author: kay cohlmia

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY ONE TERRIBLE AND RUDE CUSTOMER SUPPORT AND CAN'T  GET TO ALL FEATURES
customer_reviews.text: I had a terrible time getting it rot show the watch face. Still have difficult time when I chance readings to check steps or other functions. Customer service said charge would last 30 days. At the most it has only lasted 24 hours. Wanted a refund but was refused. I just an having a difficult with the settings. Have an ifitness watch and paid only $25 and it is so much better. I was told I wasn't doing it right and no refund. DON'T BUY ONE!M!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne VanDewark

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but probably just get a Fitbit or Garmin for similar price of you are into fitness.
customer_reviews.text: It functions fine as a watch. If you leave continuous heart rate and sleep tracking off, the battery lasts about 15 days, and if you leave them on about 10 days. The button constantly gets pressed and starts tracking a workout, which is incredibly frustrating. The band is comfortable and fits well, feels like a typical sports watch. Would be nice if you didn't have to download a 3rd party app to customize the button functions and get access to decent watch faces.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Harbert

customer_reviews.title: Battery
customer_reviews.text: I receive the product in USA and Back Home last week, i didn’t try the Amazfit before, so yesterday, i gave this amazfit to my dad, and the watch didn’t work, didn’t recharge the Battery, and i can t change the product. I m very sad because it was the only thing that my father Wanted.... i hope tha nobody have a bad surprise like me anymore, and i Wanna talk With seller, how can i do? F.P
customer_reviews.author: Fabiana Carvalho

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: Will not track my sleep. The apps I have tried don't work correctly with the watch. I only bought this watch to track my sleep and track my cycling and it doesn't do it correctly.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for Christmas, It didn’t even last a year. The face popped off, no big deal I just glued it back on. Now it doesn’t track steps. Now to buy what I should of in the beginning, a Fitbit
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't connect to the phone !!!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as we switched to winter time this watch stopped working. No matter what we did, it can't connect to the cell. We recently installed and reinstalled app number of times nothing helped. For the last two months this is what we see ( photo attached) Don't waste your money. DO NOT BUY THIS WATCH!
customer_reviews.author: Олег Горлач

customer_reviews.title: the app doesn't work that well
customer_reviews.text: The watch itself is fine, but when it comes to updated info on the app, it doesn't connect to the phone that well.
customer_reviews.author: Yang Pei Liu

customer_reviews.title: Looks different than pictured
customer_reviews.text: So the Cinabar red is really just orange. The material the case is made of is cheap plastic. It came with no directions to set it up. You have to go to the App Store and download an app to set it up. It is very light which is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Need to return/replace - Keeps vibrating saying bluetooth out of range
customer_reviews.text: It keep vibrates saying not reachable to mobile it paired to, Though it is very close by. Kind of I need to ignore that signal/beep/vibrate. But that is annoying. Would like to check with Amazefit if there is any support
customer_reviews.author: Naresh

customer_reviews.title: Did not last... Nothing but trouble with this
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my teenager and really had nothing but trouble with battery life, it not working correctly etc. very disappointing. Would not recommend.. currently wont even tell correct time even when synced.
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Having the watch actually WORK!
customer_reviews.text: Watch froze up numerous times, cannot get it to pair up with iPhone, followed ALL INSTRUCTIONS TO PAIR BUT nothing works! A piece of JUNK! Can not get a response back from manufacturer, left numerous text emails still NOTHING , terrible customer support! NeedI say more...? N O !
customer_reviews.author: bob mcdermott

customer_reviews.title: Great fitness tracker/smart watch
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Amazfit Bip watch for about a month now and it's done everything I've needed it to with excellence. I wanted a watch that could track steps, calories burned, heart rate, and sleep but would have a good battery life as well. The weather functionality and message displays were both added benefits, but I wasn't looking for them initially. The battery has drained about 25% in 3 weeks, which is absolutely amazing for any type of smart watch, and it's done all the things I needed from it. I'd definitely buy this product again!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I've made all year!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the TicWatch S last year and it died within weeks. Horrible, horrible product. This watch looks great, battery lasts forever! I went to London for two weeks, wore it all day and night long, tracking 25,000+ steps a day and only used 1/4 to 1/2 the battery. It's really simple to use. Bare bones. Can't do alot with it that you can do with other smart watches, but as an activity tracker it's excellent. Haven't worn a watch in years. And this is a welcome return.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly L'Heureux

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life, Activity Tracker, Addtional notification settings.
customer_reviews.text: I have an android. I use the app "Notify and Fitness for Mi Band" for extra customization on top of the Mi Fit app (music controls, custom notifications). I have integrated the activity/sleep tracking with Google Fit. Battery life lasts about 20-25 days and is a definite plus, depending on use (activity tracking with GPS. Sleep tracking is adequate, but I tend to take off the watch while sleeping or showering.
customer_reviews.author: Eaton Fong

customer_reviews.title: What battery life?
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this watch. The most appealing thing was battery life. I am thoroughly disappointed. I have turned off every possible feature and factory reset the device a couple of times and I am getting, at best, 3 days of battery life. What a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Adrien Fox

product_meta.title: Amazfit BIP smartwatch by Huami with All-Day Heart Rate & Activity Tracking, Sleep Monitoring, GPS, 30-Day Battery Life, Bluetooth (Cinnabar Red), One Size
product_meta.description: Color:Cinnabar Red| Style:BipWith a range of colors and options, the Bip is designed to be worn as an extension of your personal
feature_bullets: Look as Good as You Feel: With a range of colors and options, the Bip is designed to be worn as an extension of your personal style. Weighing only 1.1oz (32g), and with a bright, transflective always-on 1.28" display, the Bip can be worn all day.
Go the Distance: Use the Amazfit Bip for up to 30 days on a single 2.5-hour charge.

Don't Miss a Beat: Optical heart rate monitoring and built-in GPS allow you to accurately track in real-time your steps taken, distance traveled, calories burned, and quality of sleep. Special sport modes (running, treadmill, cycling and walking) give you even more detailed insights into your most frequent activities.

Be in the Know: The perfect companion to keep you organized and productive all day long. Receive one-way notifications for emails, SMS messages, and incoming phone calls (prompting you to take action on your smartphone), as well as alerts for Facebook, Twitter, WhatsApp, LinkedIn, Snap, Slack, weather forecasts, and other mobile apps.
Satisfaction Guaranteed: Buy with confidence. Amazfit offers a 30-day refund policy, and 12-month new replacement warranty.
